name: Data-science-resources
tagline: All the resources you could ever want for doing data science.
body:
# Heads-Up! Lots of great resources below.
This is the [Boulder Data Science](www.meetup.com/BoulderDataScience/) repo for all of the best resources we find across the web. From learning the basics to hacking on projects and getting jobs, it's all here.

### Machine Learning in Python
- [scikit-learn documentation](http://scikit-learn.org/stable/): The primary machine learning package for Python. From preprocessing to models to evaluation, it's all here.

### Neural Networks / Deep Learning
- [Neural Networks and Deep Learning](http://neuralnetworksanddeeplearning.com/chap1.html): An online book that teaches you neural networks in 6 chapters, from simple perceptrons to deep learning.
- [Google / Udacity Deep Learning Course](https://www.udacity.com/course/deep-learning--ud730)
- [Deep Learning, NLP, and Representations](http://colah.github.io/posts/2014-07-NLP-RNNs-Representations/)
- [OpenAI](https://openai.com/)

### Data Science for Good
- [DataKind](http://www.datakind.org/)
- [Open Data Science Initiative](http://opendsi.cc/)

### Data Visualization
- [Seaborn](https://stanford.edu/~mwaskom/software/seaborn/): An easy and beautiful Python visualization tool. Builds off of matplotlib.
- [matplotlib](http://matplotlib.org/): The main data visualization library in Python.
- [A Neural Network Playground](http://playground.tensorflow.org/): One of the best visualization tools for how neural networks work, completely in-browser.
- [ConvNetJS](http://cs.stanford.edu/people/karpathy/convnetjs/): Deep Learning in your browser.
- [Setosa.io](http://setosa.io/)

### Competitions
- [Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/): The self-proclaimed "Home of Data Science".

### Auto-ML
- [auto-sklearn](https://github.com/automl/auto-sklearn): Automated machine learning toolkit for Python.
- [The Automated Statistician](http://www.automaticstatistician.com/static/assets/auto-report-affairs.pdf)

## Learning the Foundations
### Resources for Learning and Help
- [Stack Overflow](http://stackoverflow.com/)
- [Cross Validated](http://stats.stackexchange.com/)

### Statistics
- [Introduction to Statistical Learning](http://www-bcf.usc.edu/~gareth/ISL/ISLR%20First%20Printing.pdf): A highly-praised introduction to everything you need to know about statistics and machine learning.
- [Elements of Statistical Learning](https://web.stanford.edu/~hastie/local.ftp/Springer/OLD/ESLII_print4.pdf): A more math-heavy version of "Intro to Statistical Learning".

### Maths
- [Singular Value Decomposition](https://www.metacademy.org/graphs/concepts/singular_value_decomposition)

### Programming in Python
- [Learn Python the Hard Way](http://learnpythonthehardway.org/): Just learning Python? There's a reason this online tutorial is so popular.
- [Anaconda](https://www.continuum.io/downloads): All the data science packages you need, wrapped up in a nice single bundle.
- [Jupyter Notebooks](http://jupyter.org/)

### GitHub
- [The Git Book](https://git-scm.com/book/): The quintessential git book.
- [Try Git](https://try.github.io): Got 15 minutes? Try git in-browser.
- [GitHub Pages](https://pages.github.com/): Build websites hosted using GitHub.
- [GitHub Pages & Jekyll](http://jmcglone.com/guides/github-pages/): Jekyll is a static site generator that works really well with GitHub Pages.

### Get in Touch
Got a stellar resource to add to this list? Send us a message on the [BDS Meetup page](), or submit a pull request to the 'gh-pages' branch of [this resources repo]().
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
